text:
Thanks Nils. That's intersting, but merely suggestive. I don't think there's anything there that would convince me this virus has any phenotype. It certainly _could_, but I've read the papers they cite at the beginning, and those were also pretty speculative.

Viruses mutate, we'd expect lots of mutations to occur in spike, and some variants by chance will spread more readily.

elements.text: Thanks Nils. That's intersting, but merely suggestive. I don't think there's anything there that would convince me this virus has any phenotype. It certainly
could

, but I've read the papers they cite at the beginning, and those were also pretty speculative.

Viruses mutate, we'd expect lots of mutations to occur in spike, and some variants by chance will spread more readily.

text: Well it seems serious enough for the UK government to massively toughen the lockdown in the southeast, and for other European governments to ban flights from the UK

elements.text: Well it seems serious enough for the UK government to massively toughen the lockdown in the southeast, and for other European governments to ban flights from the UK

text: Probably a good deal of precaution there and it might turn out less bad, but it looks different from the usual "the virus is mutating" scaremongering

text: (although of course a number of papers here splashed with stories about the "mutant virus" today...)

text: Flight bans don’t appear to be particularly effective, unless you ban them all. There was some country in Eastern Europe from where many covid-19 positive people were coming to Finland. It was easy to test them as they came in one plane. Then we banned flights from that country, which caused that the people were coming via many other airports and flights around Europe making them harder to test.

elements.text: Flight bans don’t appear to be particularly effective, unless you ban them all. There was some country in Eastern Europe from where many covid-19 positive people were coming to Finland. It was easy to test them as they came in one plane. Then we banned flights from that country, which caused that the people were coming via many other airports and flights around Europe making them harder to test.

text:
Well, I'm not going to second guess pubic health measures - it's not my area of expertise. But based on the stuff <@UDB26738Q> and <@U6A936746> have been sharing, seems like maybe they should have been locked down for a while now.

Anyway, it's possible that it makes sense to change policy based on a potential, or is possible that people in charge of making decisions are misinformed. Or it's possible that they're interpreting the data differently than me and it's totally possible they're right and I'm wrong :man-shrugging:
